title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message:
This Macbook A1708   A820-00840 Came in today  customer stated that some water spilled on it , it was working then suddenly shut down. So I inspected the board and found no water damaged wheresoever on the board  , as I connected  amp meter i am getting 20v but nothing else , I proceeded get the motherboard out to test and found diode mode readings are fine but PPBUS_G3H 0.111V I checked U7000 For short and all was good I checked F7000 in continuity mode and it was fine and in diode mode 0.404 ohms , I have also checked U6990 for short and all diode mode readinds are fine but -PP3V3_G3H  is 0.111V 

May I please get some help?

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message:
USB-C power inputs switch to 20V without 3V3_G3H???
That's very strange; was the battery disconnected?

Test the board alone on the desk, only charger connected.
Do you get 20V at R7020?

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message: Sorry I Have made a mistake regarding the 3V3_G3H   , this power rail is ok i am getting the 3.73V when USB -C is connected  and also getting 20V  at R7020 with battery disconnected  but still PPBUS_G3H is not present.

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message:
Post U7000 basic voltage;
P_IN, AUX_DET, VDDA/P, CHR_A/BMON, AUX_OK.

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message:
PPBUS_G3H  = 0.908V 

PPBUS-G3H in diode mode  = 0.408 ohms

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message:
Here are the basic voltages of U7000

P_IN = 20.30V
AUX_DET = 4.8V
VDDA = 5.07 V
VDDP = 5.07V
AUX_OK.= 3.375V 

CHR_A/BMON,?

 I could not find any related components connected to those power rails since they are output ,Would you please give me any referral of any components connected to those two power rails that i can find out what their voltages are ?

Thank you very much

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message:
I was expecting you check resistors ohm value.
Also need to check the MOSFETs between there pins; better to remove and check for open/clos outside.
I didn't say to check against ground.

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message: Ah ok , but for the MOSFETs , I did check their pins , I will check the value of the resistors in ohm , I can also review the MOSFETs again .

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message: When I check R7030 and R7040 Pin in ohm , both resistors are giving me the same value 0.4 ohm and The MOSFETs comparing to a known good working board they are giving me the same reading as the good board.

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message:
You should check if MOSFETs open/close each channel, outside of board.
Many videos on Internet, about how to check a MOSFET.

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message: ok , i will watch one of the videos to see and will follow up with you.

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message:
I was trying to get some specific video about the MOSFET open and close but i am not coming across a good clear one do you happen to have any good ones that i can go to ? 

Thank you very much .

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message:
I was trying to get some specific video about the MOSFET open and close but i am not coming across a good clear one do you happen to have any good ones that i can go to ? 

Thank you very much .

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message:
Change them directly if you have  scrap boards.
In fact, I never found bad Q7030/40, but few times I saw Q3100/200 failing.
In your case, Q3100/200 should be good if power ports switch to 20V.

As general rule, Gate pin of MOSFET must show OL (diode mode) with any other pin; measured out of board!
Source-Drain should measure like a diode (silicium).

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message: Ok , Then  You suggest that I change Q7030/Q7040 which I did last night both of them  just to see if the behaviour would change but the result remained the same I am not too sure if U7000 is my culprit , I was going to simply remove it by a new one to see if I get a boot , let me know if you suggest me to do so .

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message:
I left U7000 as last option, if all previous mentioned components are good.
You should change it, if have known good one.

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message: I have changed  Q7030/Q7040   to newer ones  but still not ok , but there s something that i found here , I have another known good board that i am comparing the values with , on my know good board PPBUS_G3H resistance value in diode is is 0.287ohms  and on the board that  i am trying to repair it's 0.408 ohms which I found too high and If I try to look for short using 3v on the DCSP there s no consumption wheresover.  Do you suggest that i change directly  Q3100/200? I am thinking that they are doing ok since i am getting my 20V

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message:
Don't touch USB-C area, if you get 20V!

How can you suspect a short, when you get higher reading to ground???
BTW, is strange to mention "resistance value" in diode mode; don't write "ohm" after diode mode reading (nor V).
Diode mode readings to ground differ if on that rail is connected a Schottky diode, or not.

You should always compare diode mode readings on PPBUS_G3H power rail in reverse mode too; black probe connected to ground.

Check diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message: Ok , I agree , Let me do that , I do not touch the USB-C area at all .

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message: PPBUS-G3H in reverse mode promptly goes to 1.989  then changed to OL  , Let me check   SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message:
SMBUS_BATT_SCL   =0.390

SMBUS_BATT_SDA  = 0.391

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message:
All values look good.
Try changing U7000.

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message: I have a few here I believed that I got them from Rossmangroupstore , but they are 9239CO but the original one on  the board is 9239HI  would they work the same?

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message:
I have taken my time to check entirely all the power lines of U7000 from a known good board to compare with the one that i am repairing ,this is a very small report of the lines that i found in diode mode too low and some others too high 

TBA_GATE Q4 on the good board I have in diode mode 0.750 and on the bad one i am getting 0.719
PPBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG on good board diode mode is 0.273 and on bad board  0.405
TBA_CSOR_P good board  = 0.273 and bad board is 0.405
PPVIN_G3H_CHGR Good board =0.449  and bad board is 0.519
TBA_CSOR_N good board is 0.272 and bad board is 0.405
TBA_LX2 good board is 0.337 and bad board is 0.302
TBA_GATE_Q1 good board is 0.751 and bad board is 0.715

I am not sure if that could give us an idea of why some of those lines are high and other ones a little lower , the other lines that i did not mention are all  equal values comparing the good board to the bad one.
I hope that it is not a inner layer issue , the customer reported that before the macbook went off completely it was going off then turn back on by itself  after the water spilled on it but the board is intact no sign of water on the board at all.
Please help me out .

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message:
Board has been affected for liquid somewhere, for sure.
Change U7000 before continue.

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message: Yes , I did Replace U7000 and the behavior remained the same . I have asked you an idea regarding the original U7000 chip with the marking 9239HI and the one I purchased 9239CO if they make a difference , I have also reballed 3 different U7000 from donor boards and no luck at all, I got the new ones with marking 9239CO let me know if they work the same.

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message:
I don't remember to done such a swap; it should work, I think.

Check PPBUS_G3H and 3V3_G3H with both charger and battery connected.

title: 820-00840-A  No boot

title: 820-00840-A  No boot

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message: Try reballing SMC...

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message:
A very quick update , I think that i got the issue figured out , What I did at last i used my thermal imager to scan anything for short , and i found right next to U2800 right above it which is not even mention on the schematics neither the board view but the Markings on that chip is PI3U5B32 looking like a voltage regulator right beside the back of the magsafe it is  so i removed and replaced it and Boom I got a boot , it is now charging pulling 33.8 Watts and 1.78 Amps 
Iam keeping an eye on it as during the process i had to replace that chip twice and the second one is the one working now , so i also had to replace U7000 As the 9239CO was not working .

I will keep on monitoring it if anything I will let you know , thank you for now for keeping up with me in everything step of the way , I really appreciate it 

.

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message: Sorry for so much of typos , I meant in every step of the way , my apologies .

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message:
USB redriver chip fails a lot on these boards; many threads about it on the forum.
But is first time when someone found it bad when USB power ports switch to 20V; really strange.
We have to note this issue; thanks for feedback.

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message:
It really Is , I am keeping an  eye on it to see if  There will be any side affects it shows that it is charging but not showing the battery percentage as customer did not provide the password to unlock it .So let's keep an eye on it , I think some of those issues can also be detected via Thermal camera as they do provide heat.

Thanks again I will keep you in the loop if it's fully working.

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message: Keep at hand an USB pendrive with preinstalled macOS for tests.

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message: I don't have one here with me , I will have to order one , I am not that familiar with them , Maybe i would need to replace back the Q7030 And Q7040 To their original ones , Would you suggest that?

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message:
No need to replace them, if you changed with equivalent.

You can find lot of information on Internet (including videos), about how to create preinstalled macOS pendrive.
Be aware, is not easy to find good pendrives; many of times are too slow, even being marked as USB 3.1  :(.
Better to use an SSD with SATA to USB 3.1 adapter.

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message: Ok I Took notes , I will start working on that  thank you so much for the infos.

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message: Ok, sometimes I realize that some of the chips pulled off the donors are not 100% working that was why I said that,  but so far the macbook is charging  but i am still skeptical as its pulling 20,39 watts now and 0.95 amps but battery is half way charged. I tried to disconnect  the charger and its staying on .

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message: Now I just shut the  macbook down and I disconnected the USB charger, the battery is charged at 69% but as soon as i power it on without the USB charger connected , it boots half way with the apple logo than power off , then when i press the power button it would ask me to connect the charger, what do you suggest  in that case , Can a bad battery does that?

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message: You should test with known good battery, if want to discard it.

title: 820-00840-A  No boot
message: I was able to get a hold of the passcode and indeed the system is saying that the battery needs replacement , therefore I informed the customer and he stated Yes he s well aware of that so i am getting a new replacement battery to complete the repair process, Thank you so very much .
